metadata.research_notes: Comprehensive index of all publicly documented Epstein-related legal cases including criminal prosecutions, civil lawsuits, estate claims, and institutional settlements. All case numbers, dates, and outcomes verified from court records, DOJ announcements, and news sources.

criminal_cases.case_name: State of Florida v. Jeffrey Epstein
criminal_cases.sentence: 18 months incarceration (13 months served with work release), 12 months probation, sex offender registration
criminal_cases.controversy: Non-prosecution agreement violated Crime Victims' Rights Act. Federal prosecutors prepared 53-page indictment but entered NPA instead. Victims not informed of plea deal.

criminal_cases.court: U.S. District Court, Southern District of New York
charges: Sex trafficking of minors (18 U.S.C. ยง 1591)
Conspiracy to engage in sex trafficking of minors (18 U.S.C. ยง 1594(c))
criminal_cases.allegations: Sex trafficking and abuse of dozens of underage girls as young as 14, between 2002-2005, in New York and Palm Beach
criminal_cases.death_circumstances: Found unresponsive in MCC cell 6:30 AM, ruled suicide by hanging

criminal_cases.court: U.S. District Court, Southern District of New York
charges: Transportation of a minor with intent to engage in criminal sexual activity
Enticement of a minor to travel to engage in illegal sex acts
Conspiracy to entice minors to travel to engage in illegal sex acts
Conspiracy to transport minors with intent to engage in criminal sexual activity
victims_testified: Carolyn (first name only) - age 14 in early 2000s
criminal_cases.status: Serving sentence - transferred to minimum security 2025

civil_individual_cases.case_name: Virginia L. Giuffre v. Ghislaine Maxwell
civil_individual_cases.court: U.S. District Court, Southern District of New York
civil_individual_cases.allegations: Defamation - Maxwell called Giuffre's sex trafficking allegations 'obvious lies'
civil_individual_cases.significance: Source of most public Epstein documents. Depositions, flight logs, witness testimony, emails.
civil_individual_cases.notable_revelations: 150+ associates named, flight logs, deposition testimony from Giuffre, Maxwell, others

civil_individual_cases.case_name: Virginia L. Giuffre v. Prince Andrew, Duke of York
civil_individual_cases.court: U.S. District Court, Southern District of New York
civil_individual_cases.allegations: Sexual assault and battery when Giuffre was 17 years old, facilitated by Epstein and Maxwell
civil_individual_cases.locations_alleged: London, New York, U.S. Virgin Islands
civil_individual_cases.settlement_terms: Financial payment to Giuffre, donation to her charity supporting victims' rights, no admission of liability by Prince Andrew

civil_individual_cases.case_name: Jennifer Araoz v. Estate of Jeffrey Epstein, Ghislaine Maxwell, et al.
civil_individual_cases.allegations: Sexual assault and rape when Araoz was 14-15 years old at Epstein's NYC townhouse, including forcible rape in 2002
civil_individual_cases.legal_basis: Filed under New York's Child Victims Act
civil_individual_cases.outcome: Likely settled (part of estate compensation fund)
civil_individual_cases.significance: First lawsuit filed after Epstein's death, under new Child Victims Act window

civil_individual_cases.case_name: Jane Doe v. Donald J. Trump and Jeffrey E. Epstein
civil_individual_cases.court: U.S. District Court, Southern District of New York
civil_individual_cases.allegations: Sexual assault at Epstein's residence when plaintiff was 13 years old in 1994

civil_individual_cases.court: U.S. District Court, Southern District of Florida
civil_individual_cases.allegations: Violation of Crime Victims' Rights Act - federal prosecutors failed to confer with victims before executing non-prosecution agreement with Epstein in 2008
civil_individual_cases.outcome: Mixed - District court ruled CVRA violated, Eleventh Circuit reversed
civil_individual_cases.district_court_ruling: Federal prosecutors violated Crime Victims' Rights Act by not conferring with victims
civil_individual_cases.appeals_court_ruling: CVRA not triggered because no charges filed; Wild could have moved for relief but cannot bring standalone suit
civil_individual_cases.legislative_response: Courtney Wild Crime Victims' Rights Reform Act introduced in Congress
civil_individual_cases.significance: Exposed illegal non-prosecution agreement, led to legislative reform efforts
civil_individual_cases.status: Appeals exhausted, led to legislative reform proposals

bank_settlement_cases.case_name: Jane Doe 1, et al. v. JPMorgan Chase Bank, N.A.
bank_settlement_cases.court: U.S. District Court, Southern District of New York
bank_settlement_cases.allegations: Bank profited from and facilitated Epstein's sex trafficking operation from 1998-2013 by providing financial services despite red flags
bank_settlement_cases.related_litigation: JPMorgan sued former executive Jes Staley for $80+ million

bank_settlement_cases.case_name: Jane Doe, et al. v. Deutsche Bank AG
bank_settlement_cases.court: U.S. District Court, Southern District of New York
bank_settlement_cases.allegations: Bank enabled and benefitted from Epstein's sex trafficking from 2013-2018
bank_settlement_cases.victim_compensation: $75,000 to $5 million per victim depending on claim evaluation
bank_settlement_cases.significance: Largest sex trafficking settlement with a bank in US history (per plaintiffs' attorneys)
bank_settlement_cases.status: Settled for $75 million, final approval October 2023

estate_claims.case_name: Government of the U.S. Virgin Islands v. Estate of Jeffrey Epstein
estate_claims.court: Superior Court of the Virgin Islands
estate_claims.plaintiff: Attorney General of the U.S. Virgin Islands
estate_claims.allegations: Sex trafficking operation on Little St. James Island, fraudulent tax benefits
estate_claims.settlement_purpose: Funds directed to trust for USVI victims of sexual assault, trafficking, and child abuse

estate_claims.usvi_intervention_reason: Original fund included broad releases not in victims' interest, lacked confidentiality protections
estate_claims.process: Claims filed, evaluated, compensated without litigation
estate_claims.significance: Provided compensation to 136 victims without prolonged litigation

courtlistener.description: Free public access to PACER documents via RECAP archive
courtlistener.cost: Free for documents in RECAP archive

pacer.cost: $0.10 per page, capped at $3.00 per document

document_cloud.description: Many Epstein documents uploaded by journalists

archive_org.description: House Oversight Committee releases archived here
